physical_examinations.relevant_findings: High serum ferritin concentration of 1125 Î¼g/L; palmar erythema; slight liver enlargement; distinctive cataracts seen during clinical examination.
Bilateral central and peripheral crystalline cataracts identified by slit lamp examination.
Successful cataract surgery on one eye for the patient's teenage son; substantial nocturnal glare impacting driving confidence.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Nocturnal glare in son affecting driving confidence noted to have not improved prior to cataract surgery.
